basics.name: Matt Nemitz
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I'm a full-stack software engineer with experience in frontend development, audio processing and backend development.

work.summary: As part of the DevX team, I build tools and services to optimise developer experience for Speechmatics customers.
highlights: Lead developer of the [Speechmatics JS SDK](https://github.com/speechmatics/speechmatics-js-sdk), a set of tools for developing speech-powered applications on all JS platforms.
Built large features for the [Speechmatics Portal](https://portal.speechmatics.com), a web application for managing Speechmatics accounts and projects (written in Remix).

Drove the development of the [Speechmatics developer docs site](https://docs.speechmatics.com) using exclusively open-source tools, and offering a first-class developer experience on par with paid providers like Fern.
Built a [mobile app](https://apps.apple.com/gb/app/speechmatics-flow/id6673918783) with the team in React Native showcasing Speechmatics Voice AI capabilities.

work.summary: On the Velocity team at Habito, I undertook projects to streamline developer tooling within the company.
highlights: Built tools for generating REST APIs and clients in Typescript from [Smithy](https://smithy.io/) and [OpenAPI](https://www.openapis.org/) definitions.
Contributed UI developments to the main website built using Purescript, and backend services in Haskell.

work.summary: I worked on the mobile app and backend for Crisp, a fully online supermarket serving the Netherlands and Belgium.
highlights: Built several UI features in React Native, including allowing users to add products to a pending order in a single tap.
Worked with the warehouse teams to improve internal order management system UI
